item.title: Partho wins big in Bhola-1
item.description: Bangladesh Jatiya Party (BJP) Chairman Andaleeve Rahman Partho has won the Bhola-1 constituency in the 13th national election by a significant margin. He secured 104,462 votes with the party’s ‘Bullock Cart’ symbol. His nearest rival, Jamaat-e-Islami candidate Principal Nazrul I

item.title: Bobby Hajjaj wins Dhaka-13 as rival Mamunul alleges fake ballots, delays
item.description: BNP candidate Bobby Hajjaj has been declared the winner in the Dhaka‑13 constituency, covering Mohammadpur and Dhanmondi, despite allegations of irregularities. Hajjaj secured 88,387 votes in the constituency, while his nearest rival, Khelafat Majlis chief Mamunul Haque, received 86,067 votes -- a

item.title: BNP’s Jahangir wins Dhaka‑18 seat
item.description: BNP candidate SM Jahangir has won the Dhaka‑18 constituency, covering Uttara, Turag, Khilkhet, Dakshinkhan, Uttar Khan and the airport area, by a margin of 33,000 votes. Jahangir received 144,715 votes, while his closest rival Ariful Islam from the National Citizen Party secured 111,297. The seat

item.title: US greets BNP, Tarique Rahman on poll victory
item.description: The United States has congratulated the people of Bangladesh for successfully holding the national election, and extended its best wishes to the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) and its chairman Tarique Rahman for their historic victory. In a statement issued by the US Embassy on Friday morning,

item.title: Jamaat pledges positive politics
item.description: Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami Ameer Dr Shafiqur Rahman has alleged that results of a number of constituencies were not being declared. "We are certain as we have signed papers that show that we (Jamaat alliance candidates) are leading. But the outcome of the voting is yet to be declared," he told the

item.title: First-time voters turn out in force
item.description: First-time voters turned out in large numbers across the capital on Thursday, many expressing enthusiasm and high expectations for political and institutional change. For these young citizens, the 13th national election represents more than a routine exercise in democracy - it is an opportunity to

item.title: Global media hail peaceful Bangladesh polls
item.description: International media outlets have described Thursday's parliamentary elections in Bangladesh as largely peaceful and mostly free of violence, as vote counting progressed following the country's first national election since the 2024 mass uprising. Global coverage framed the election as a significan

item.title: Barrister Fuad congratulates his opponent on victory
item.description: Barishal-3 (Babuganj–Muladi) candidate Barrister Fuad has congratulated his opponent, Zainul Abedin, on his electoral victory, expressing gratitude to the voters and party leaders who supported him throughout the campaign. In a Facebook post on Friday morning, he thanked the 61,192 respected

item.title: Modi congratulates Tarique Rahman on BNP’s decisive poll victory
item.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday conveyed his warm congratulations to Tarique Rahman on leading BNP to a decisive victory in the Parliamentary elections in Bangladesh. “This victory shows the trust of the people of Bangladesh in your leadership,” Modi said in a message. I

item.title: Jamaat warns of tough movement if electoral manipulation is found
item.description: Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami on Friday warned of launching a tough movement if people’s opinions and voting rights are manipulated through any conspiracy. Jamaat’s Assistant Secretary General Ehsanul Mahbub Jubayer came up with the warning while talking to reporters on The Election &nbsp

item.title: EC withholds results of three constituencies
item.description: The Election Commission has decided to withhold the results of three constituencies as court cases are pending against the declared winning candidates. The constituencies are Sherpur-2, Chattogram-2 and Chattogram-4. The EC issued three separate letters in this regard on Thursday. The EC said th

item.title: Syndicate profits from illegal Rohingya settlements established razing hills
item.description: COX'S BAZAR, Feb 12: A well-organised syndicate has allegedly been running a lucrative rental business by establishing illegal Rohingya settlements outside the registered refugee camps in Ukhiya and Teknaf of Cox's Bazar, cutting down hills to create makeshift housing.
